claim: A majority of posts on the Codebase Community platform that offer a bounty amount of at least 30 are promoted by their authors on external social media sites.
extra_info: bounty amount over 30 refers to BountyAmount > = 30;
reasoning: The claim asserts that a majority of posts with BountyAmount >= 30 are 'promoted by their authors on external social media sites.' While BountyAmount exists in the votes table, there is no column, table, or data anywhere in the database that tracks whether posts are promoted on external social media sites. This is an out-of-schema concept that cannot be verified from the available data.

content.text: I need to check if the database contains information about posts being "promoted on external social media sites." Let me first explore the schema.

badges       postHistory  posts        users      
comments     postLinks    tags         votes

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: The `posts` table has no column for "BountyAmount" or anything about social media promotion. Let me check the `votes` table and other tables for bounty information.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE votes
(
    Id           INTEGER  not null
        primary key,
    PostId       INTEGER  null,
    VoteTypeId   INTEGER  null,
    CreationDate DATE null,
    UserId       INTEGER  null,
    BountyAmount INTEGER  null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

    LinkTypeId    INTEGER      null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (RelatedPostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade

content.text:
I found `BountyAmount` in the `votes` table. Now, the claim mentions posts being "promoted by their authors on external social media sites." There is no column or table in this database that tracks whether posts are promoted on external social media sites. This concept is entirely out-of-schema.

Let me confirm there's nothing related to social media promotion anywhere in the database:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" ".schema badges" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" ".schema comments" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" ".schema tags" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" ".schema users"

content.content:
CREATE TABLE badges
(
    Id     INTEGER          not null
        primary key,
    UserId INTEGER          null,
    Name   TEXT null,
    Date   DATETIME     null,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);
CREATE TABLE comments
(
    Id              INTEGER          not null
        primary key,
    PostId          INTEGER          null,
    Score           INTEGER          null,
    Text            TEXT     null,
    CreationDate    DATETIME     null,
    UserId          INTEGER          null,
    UserDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);
CREATE TABLE tags
(
    Id            INTEGER          not null
        primary key,
    TagName       TEXT null,
    Count         INTEGER          null,
    ExcerptPostId INTEGER          null,
    WikiPostId    INTEGER          null,
    foreign key (ExcerptPostId) references posts (Id)
        on update cascade on delete cascade
);
CREATE TABLE users
(
    Id              INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    Reputation      INTEGER          null,
    CreationDate    DATETIME     null,
    DisplayName     TEXT null,
    LastAccessDate  DATETIME     null,
    WebsiteUrl      TEXT null,
    Location        TEXT null,
    AboutMe         TEXT     null,
    Views           INTEGER          null,
    UpVotes         INTEGER          null,
    DownVotes       INTEGER          null,
    AccountId       INTEGER          null,
    Age             INTEGER          null,
    ProfileImageUrl TEXT null
);

No table or column in the entire database tracks whether posts are "promoted on external social media sites." This is an out-of-schema concept that cannot be verified.
